revised_title: Evolution of Passive Continental Margins in the North Atlantic Ocean
tldr: The authors analyze the results of deep drilling at Site 398 in the Galicia Bank area, providing insights into the evolution of passive continental margins in the North Atlantic Ocean. They discuss the lithologic and stratigraphic evidence from the drilling site and regional seismic reflection data, placing it in the context of the early tectonic evolution of the North Atlantic Ocean. The study reveals the morphology of the western Iberian continental margin and the initial creation of the interior basin filled with pre-Neocomian sediments, related to the Permo-Triassic-Liassic and/or late Jurassic to early Cretaceous distensive episodes.
